name: Radisson Hotel at Los Angeles Airport

reviews.text: Get off your plane and be in bed in 1 hour, its that close. I had a little problem and the manager took care of it, great staff! My room came with a sleep number bed (I could not get it to work) but it gave me a great sleep. Bathroom had a good shower and the breakfast buffet is worth twice the price you'll pay, it was great! This is the best hotel deal at the airport "THE BEST"
reviews.title: Best Deal at LAX 4+

reviews.text: Very very close to airport and has free shuttle service from airport but we waited almost 1 hour for the shuttle. Room was decent and nice for the price we paid. bell boys were very helpful and nice. We stayed one night and left early morning so it was good night sleep.
reviews.title: Ok!

reviews.text: I was just landed from a long flight and in need of shower and rest when this hotel had their electricity off for few hours. i couldnt even take a good bath when the lights off. fortunately its still spring and the weather were comfortable enough for me to sleep..but to stay in this hotel again? definitely no! the front desk was a bit umfriendly but the bellboys were very helpful though..
reviews.title: Unpleasant stay..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unbelievable experience at our most vulnerable moment...after 20 hours of international travel we use the terminal courtesy phone to contact the front desk to arrange the free shuttle we desperately needed after crossing 13 time zones. Told to wait under the "green sign", step outside and see many green signs but decide to wait...see Hilton and other shuttles driving by every 5 minutes, so why not wait like everyone else.
reviews.title: Worthless shuttle and outdated rooms, dull-eyed staff

reviews.text: 15 minutes later, no shuttle. Call 6 times without answer, on the 7th the desk responded they "missed us" so we wait again having seen zero Radisson shuttles. Eventually we give up, after an hour, and take a taxi...becuase the front desk refuses to answer the phones, no matter whether we chose Operator or Concierge from the phone menu.
reviews.title: Solid airport hotel

reviews.text: Property is a little run down and dated so some renovations would be welcome. But for an overnight between our SYD-LAX and LAX-JFK flight is prefectly adequate. The rooms were on the small size but nothing unusal for an Airport Hotel. The beds were very comfortable and we all had a good sleep which is what we needed after a 13 hour flight and the nightmare of clearing Immigration and Customs at the Tom Bradly terminal....2 hours of frustration. The bathroom was compact and date but again did the job.
reviews.title: Perfectly Adequate Airport Hotel

reviews.text: Staff were all welcoming and helpful with special mention to Abel who was working in the bar the night we were there. I needed to do a couple of hours works and Abel got me sorted out with wi-fi, a couple of beers and some good conversation.
reviews.title: No Water?!?!?!

reviews.text: Locating the shuttle at LAX to get to the hotel was a bit of nighmare and took a while. We saw several shuttles from other airport hotels in the time we were waiting for the Radisson Shuttle. Service back to the airport the next morning worked well with set departure times.
reviews.title: No water pressure means no shower, and calling front desk gets you put on extended hold.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate lunch at the restaurant and and had dinner in the bar. Food was reasonable as were the prices.
reviews.title: walking distance from LAX

reviews.text: We paid just under USD100 for the room via Expedia and at that price it represented excellent value. Would happliy use this hotel again for an overnight stopover.
reviews.title: Comfortable & Convenient

reviews.text: The hotel provided free Wifi upon check-in. Parking is $25 if you choose valet parking. Or just behind the hotel on 98th Street, there is the Sunrise Airport Parking that cost $12/night (add $2 for in-out privilege).
reviews.title: Convenient & comfortable

reviews.text: The hotel room was big enough and the beds and the beddings are very comfortable for my tired body from traveling. It also has a frig in the room. The TV we have is a Circa 1965 CRT that cuts off the most wide format broadcasting on both sides.
reviews.title: Dont expect too much

reviews.text: We'll stay here again if the price is right (we paid $125 through Priceline).
reviews.title: Typical airport hotel

reviews.text: There is a Subway sandwich shop next door (in front of Courtyard Hotel). Or if you go a couple of blocks on Hwy 1 (turn right outside the front door), there is Ralph's grocery, CVS, Starbucks, in-out Burger, IHOP and a whole bunch of other options.
reviews.title: Room dirty. TV broken.

description: Minutes from beaches, shopping and dining, our Los Angeles airport hotel is the closest hotel to Los Angeles International Airport (walking distance) with easy access to downtown Los Angeles, Hollywood, Santa Monica, Manhattan Beach and Venice Beach. The Radisson Los Angeles Hotel offers complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport. Our hotel is the ideal location, whether you are traveling on business or on a family vacation.
